required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: RAAS and Arterial Stiffness in SCI
clinical_study.official_title: Orthostatic Blood Pressure and Arterial Stiffness in Persons With SCI: The Effect of RAAS System

lead_sponsor.agency: James J. Peters Veterans Affairs Medical Center

clinical_study.source: James J. Peters Veterans Affairs Medical Center

brief_summary.textblock: The study is examining differences in central arterial stiffness, orthostatic changes in blood pressure, norepinephrine, and plasma renin in individuals with spinal cord injury compared with age-matched uninjured controls.

detailed_description.textblock: The study is examining differences in central arterial stiffness, orthostatic changes in blood pressure, norepinephrine, and plasma renin in individuals with spinal cord injury compared with age-matched uninjured controls. Arterial stiffness and blood pressure will be collected in the laying down position. A blood sample of norepinephrine and plasma renin will also be collected. The participant will tilt to 30, 45 and 60 degrees for 10 minutes at each angel. Blood pressure and heart rate will be monitored at each angle. Another blood sample of renin and norepinephrine will be collected at the end of 10 minutes at 60 degrees.

primary_outcome.description: Determine relationship between arterial stiffness, blood pressure, norepinephrine, and renin responses to head-up tilt among the groups.

secondary_outcome.description: Determine differences in blood pressure among groups
Determine differences in plasma renin among the groups
Determine differences in plasma norepinephrine among the groups.
Describe the changes in norepinephrine and renin from supine rest to 60 degree tilt

arm_group.description: Ages between 21-70 years old Injured between C1-T1 Wheelchair dependent AIS classification of A, B or C Injury occurred more than 1 year ago
Ages between 21-70 Injured between T6-T12 Wheelchair dependent AIS classification of A, B or C Injury occurred more than 1 year ago

study_pop.textblock: Outpatient individuals with SCI, flyers in town

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- SCI participants:
- injured between C1-T1 and T6-T12
- wheelchair dependent
- AIS classification A, B or C
- Injured occurred more than 1 year ago
Exclusion Criteria:
- currently have an illness or infection
- current smoker of at least 1 year
- controlled or uncontrolled hypertension or diabetes mellitus
- Neurological condition other than SCI (Alzheimer's disease, dementia, stroke, multiple sclerosis, Parkinson's disease)
- cardiovascular disease (coronary heart disease, congestive heart failure, peripheral artery disease)

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: James J. Peters Veterans Affairs Medical Center
